Reviews.Title: Vizio SV421XVT
Reviews.Author: cgamble
Reviews.Content: The Vizio SV421XVT, is a very nice 42 inch lcd TV. With 120hz refresh rate, and 240hz scenes per second, this television offers depth perception found only in high end LED TVs.The picture quality and black levels are very nice. The smooth motion is very visible and beautiful. Although we had to return 2 televsions to Vizio because they came with Stuck Bright Pixels, we are still very pleased with the TV over all.I would not recommend buying a Vizio from Vizio directly. The swap out of the units we had with Stuck Pixels with Vizio was a long painful process, but that does not take away from the picture quality of this unit. I would suggest going the route of Amazon or Wally World when purchasing, no questions asked returns.I updated this review and have shortened it greatly to focus back on the quality and performance of this unit.Amazons customer service is great, but PILOT delivery is bogus, it is not white glove and they are liars.That being said, I would recommend the SV421XVT to anyone wanting a good quality LCD at a reasonable price.It does not come with the bluetooth remote, no apps, no wifi, no 3d, and it does not hold a mega contrast ratio in the millions, this is a late 2009 model LCD, but at the current Amazon asking price, it would be perfect for the standard families everyday use.Deep blacks, little to no judder, bright whites, and crisp accurate color. 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat it for the price.
Reviews.Author: D. Sanders
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Vizio SV421VXT from Amazon on February 6th, got it on February 12th.  That's six days, and it didn't move for one of them due to bad weather.  You'll see some complaints around about the shipping company for large items (CEVA) but I had no issues at all with them.  Delivery company called, I told them I was at work, but could be home at any time for them to deliver, they just brought it to my work instead (at my request).  This may not be an option for some, but it worked out great for me since I didn't have to take any time off from work to have it delivered.  However, this review is for the TV, not the delivery company.The set works great.  I upgraded from a 27" CRT television to this 42" LCD, and obviously, the difference is stunning.  We don't have HDTV yet, but even my standard definition Dish Network looks pretty good, as does my regular DVD player over S-Video.  Blu-Ray and games on my PS3 look simply amazing.  I find the sound quality to be very good without external speakers, but my living room is on the small side (the seating is about 8' from the TV)Probably the only complaint I could say about this TV yet is that the cable they provide to hook to the wall so it won't fall over (if you aren't wall mounting) is kind of unsightly.  However, most people probably won't use it, and this is a very minor detail.  I just used it because, for one, this is a big purchase for me and I don't want to take any chances, and we have two cats that like to climb on top of the TV where it's warm...I don't think they could even lay on top of this TV, but I'm sure they will try.I did months of research on HDTVs before settling on this model from Vizio.  Overall, I found that no matter which TV you look at, there are negative reviews.  Given that, no matter which TV I purchased, I would have gotten an extended warranty to cover it in case I got one of the bad ones.  With the Vizio, I was able to get a quality set with the extended warranty for less that I could have gotten a bigger name brand without the extended warranty.Of note to anyone that is looking at 240Hz, Vizio uses a different technology to achieve 240Hz than does Sony.  I'm not saying this makes it better or worse, because I haven't compared them, but take that into consideration.

Reviews.Title: Football games won't be the same!
Reviews.Author: John E. Wineke "Go Pack!"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded my 120hz Vizio to this model for my family room and can't believe the clearity!  The colors are crisp, the picture is 2nd to none.  You can actually see the laces on a football while in the air on a spiral.  For the difference in price from the 120 to the 240hz spend it!  I did and have 0 regrets. The best TV I've ever watched mutchless in my own home!

Reviews.Title: Not A Long-Term Buy
Reviews.Author: Nia M
Reviews.Content: If you want to purchase another big-screen LCD in less than two years, buy this!If you think a product that costs this much money should last longer than two years, I'd keep looking...I purchased this model 19 months ago, and about two weeks ago it started giving me green discoloration in any place on the screen where there is dark shadowing. So basically, LOTS of green! I've done a lot of troubleshooting, some at the instruction of Vizio technical support. The discoloration is present via the HDMI cable for my HD DVR cable box and via RCA cables for my DVD player and Wii...so therefore not a problem from the inputs--it's the Vizio. Since the tv is no longer under warranty, Vizio kindly recommended third party tv repair companies...sorry, but I do not intend to pay $350 (their quote) to fix a tv that was brand new and perfect less than two years ago.A pretty thorough Google search indicates that this is not an anomaly (try it: Google 'vizio green screen') and that lots of other people have had this problem with their Vizio tvs. Apparently there is a way for me to fix it which requires taking the tv apart and replacing a $20 cable (another reason I will not be paying anyone $350!), but I have yet to try it. We'll see how that goes!Bottom line, if you think such a big purchase should last longer than 2 years, keep looking for other brands. Or if you must buy it (I'll admit, the Gold Box deal price is pretty good...), do yourself a favor and buy the extended warranty!

Reviews.Title: I'm no techie - but this is a great TV!
Reviews.Author: Kimby in Omaha "Kimby in Omaha"
Reviews.Content: I did my research and did my research and this is a GREAT TV.  Perfect! Easy to set up - simply remove from package and power it on! Remote Control and inputs are clearly marked and easy to use.  If you need to look at the user manual, it is NOT technical so you can figure out how to hook up your computer/mp3 player or whatever!And the delivery - I was a little nervous when I learned it would be a "carrier" and not UPS/FEDEX....but they were AWESOME! I'd buy again just for the AWESOME customer service from the carrier.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Aaron Brueckman "Aaron"
Reviews.Content: This TV has been precisely what I wanted.  I did a LOT of research before purchasing this TV, and kept coming back to Vizio.  My brother-in-law has an older Vizio plasma, and I was always impressed with it, so I initially looked at Vizio's anyway, but wanting to make sure I did my due-diligence, I studied just about everything I could.  Even ignoring the prices of different TVs, I kept coming back to the Vizio brand based on the quality reviews I heard/read, and the technical offerings for each of their products.  Once you add in the relatively low prices for Vizios compared to anything else on the market, it became a no-brainer.I was a bit skeptical about ordering an HDTV over the internet, but everything worked out perfectly.  The delivery guys even helped get it out of the box and up onto my TV stand.  It has worked perfectly so far since day one, and we use it quite heavily.  My wife had foot surgery the same week the TV was delivered, so she was off her feet, and spent a lot of time with the TV on the first few weeks, and yet we've had not one single problem yet.The only complaint I have with this unit has to do with Sound.  The built-in speakers themselves are just fine, and have good volume.  But I have a surround sound stereo system, and getting the two synched up was VERY difficult at first.  Ultimately, it came down to adjusting some settings in the stereo, and nothing was necessarily the TVs fault, so this is quite likely something that might be experienced with all HDTVs (never had this problem with my old SDTV).  At first, we were having a lot of lag issues with the stereo not matching up with the TV signal, or with Blu-rays/DVDs.  Now that we've got it sorted out, everything sounds great.  I do have to leave the TVs internal speakers turned off though, as they are still just slightly out-of-sync with the stereo system.  But the stereo pushes enough sound that it really makes no difference.Overall, I'm SO pleased with this purchase, and highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Love the picture...but it was faulty!
Reviews.Author: Ike
Reviews.Content: The picture is amazing.  It's better than I've seen in many store displays for ANY TV.  The motion is cool, but it does take some getting used to.  The colors and contrast looks great, and the speakers are pretty good as well.  I would have given this TV a 5 stars, but mine was faulty!  After only a few hours of watching, the screen went black.  Some are calling this the "black screen of death."  The audio still comes through, but the lights to out.  You have to turn the TV off and back on to get the picture back.  Vizio tries to get you to do a reset, but that did nothing.  I also read to turn off the adaptive luma feature, but that did not help either.  So why would I give this TV 4 stars?  Yes, the picture was that good!  Amazon made my return easy, and a new one is on the way.  I'm going to give it another go.  Hopefully, my second set won't have this same issue.  If it does, I'll have to post an updated review.  The picture is worth the gamble on another one.  Roll the dice.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: C. HOLDRE
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for a year now and couldn't be happier with it. Everyone who sees it comments on what a good picture it has. I've got other Vizio smaller TV's in other rooms but they are not as high a quality as this 240 hz is, which certainly makes sense, since they are only 60 hz. My husband was bedbound in the same room as this TV for 3 months and we hardly ever cut it off even at night because he had a hard time sleeping so he would watch it most of the night and day, it would stay on constantly for weeks at a time which was quite a work-out for it. I hope I'm not jinxing myself by bragging on it so much but I love it! I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Sound board blow out after one year
Reviews.Author: Ellen
Reviews.Content: I bought this model of Vizio TV--SV421XVT. The sound board stopped functioning after 1.5 years of owning this thing. Was told it will cost over $300 to fix. I might as well buy a new set. I can tell you one thing----I will never buy another Vizio product. I paid over $700 for this set, for less than 2 years of functioning? What a piece of junk!

Reviews.Title: This TV is the best you're going to find in this price range and size!
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: I love my new tv.  I feared getting this model after searching the internet and stores for a like tv with a better price, but none were to be found; plus I read a lot of negative feedback people left online for this item.  But, I've had nothing but positive things to say about this product.  The unit has good sound and a good picture.  I also own a 55 inch Samsung LED 8000 unit, so I know what LED looks like and this Vizio LCD looks spectacular but costs a whole lot less.  I think the sound is quite good for tv speakers, in fact, I cannot imagine stock speakers being much better.  The picture is clear and crisp.  Now, I've only had the unit for 2 weeks, so if it changes I will revise this review.  The remote is okay and simple to use; since I have ATT U-verse I use that remote to operate the tv, not the tv remote.  The Vizio on/off light is helpful in knowing by sight if the unit is left on with no signal (light turns from white (on position) to orange (off position)).  This tv has great connection options which can go unnoticed to the unexperienced buyer.  The back has several HDMI and a component ports, which are easy to reach and use.  Plus there is one HDMI and one component port on the side of the unit.  There is no ethernet connection option, but if you purchase a blu-ray/dvd player with ethernet, then you won't miss it on the tv, because you can access the internet using the blu ray/dvd player.  Happy shopping and hope this was helpful!

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture and sound
Reviews.Content: This T.V. is Awsome!! We originally ordered an Element 60hz and it was horrible! So I took it back and ordered this one. The picture is crystal clear. However, we do have the HD dish programing and dvr receiver which helps, the dish before we switched it all over to HD gave a slightly distorted image but nothing bad enough to make me send it back like the other tv. The sound is also amazing! The first tv sounded like an 80's sound system from a middle school. This one sounds just like it should. No surround sound required if your fine with having the sound just right infront of you, which I am perfectly fine with because I have a baby and would never get to "use" a surround sound anyway. I will say that one thing that takes getting used to is the picture, because of the 240hz it is exactly like you are the one holding the camera following the people around. The best I can think of to compare it to would be like a soap opera or filmed stage play, or the deleted scenes from movies- before all the editing. So, I think that film makers are going to need to step up the graphics to stay ahead of these new tv hz. It will take a brand new movie and make it look like a buget film because of how vivid and real it looks, its like 3d without being 3d. You see everything the camera guy sees. It makes scary movies, ultra scary because the thing is running right at you behind the camera, it makes me wonder if a camera guy has ever punched someone because he got lost in the scene. Anyway, great buy! I'd do it again. If your livingroom can hold it, get a 60". This tv makes me want a 60 just because it would totally be life like then.

Reviews.Title: GREAT VALUE
Reviews.Author: D. PATIENCE "7TTR6"
Reviews.Content: TV is great value, picture is very good sound tone could be a little better but this is not a Sony nor a Sony price. Overall it's easy to set up and use and gives everything I expected, I got this model with 240hz because of fast moving sports, everyone who buys this model should be pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: vizio or better name?
Reviews.Author: C. Forney "critical shopper"
Reviews.Content: I bought this 42 inch, 240 HZ, Vizio about a month ago. It has a great picture. I am concerned that it may have problems later on or as someone in another review said it could become a "large brick". The sound is pretty good, but when scenes change it will sometimes make a sound like a loud click. I am wondering if that will get worse or something else. Although I only paid $800 for it, that is still alot of money for me. Has anyone had a vizio for quite a few years and can predict what the future may hold? I could take it back now. I do love the TV, except for the clicking.

Reviews.Title: Solid Purchase
Reviews.Author: Colter H
Reviews.Content: Overall I would consider this TV a solid investment.  While it may not have the newest LED technology or sport a fancier name (Sony, Samsung, Pioneer), the setup was super easy, the sound quality is solid, the picture quality is great (especially for sports), and the packaging is stylish.  You can't ask for much more for under $900 these days.

Reviews.Title: Great TV ... You should buy one.
Reviews.Author: S. Donofrio "311Spider"
Reviews.Content: I was a bit hesitent at first to buy a Vizio because it is a "bargain brand," but after doing a lot of research on hdtv's and consulting a techie friend of mine I decided to go with this Vizio model.  I was very impressed by the picture quality of the TV, the TV's appearance, the ease of use, and even the packaging.  This is my first HDTV, and after setting it up I put it next to my regular tv, put both TV's on the same station and noticed the difference is almost night and day.  I don't know how I've gone so long with out one of these, lol.I gave only 4 stars for sound quality only because if you're going to have the best in picture quality you probably shouldn't rely on the sound that comes stock with your tv.Someone gave a review of this TV and complained about the plastic smell.  I noticed a plastic smell when I first took the TV out of the box.  I don't think it was more strong than any other tv would be, and definitely not unbearable.  After it had been out of the box for a day I did not notice it anymore, not because I was used to the smell, but because it just wasn't there or wasn't strong enough.Anyway, I've bought many things from Amazon and have not been disappointed yet.  I had ordered this TV on a Tuesday, late afternoon, and it arived at my work place on Friday afternoon.  Free, fast shipping, no tax, can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME
Reviews.Author: wolfsuit
Reviews.Content: I just got this tv delivered from amazon today, and my mind has been properly blown. Granted, I was switching to this from a standard tube set, but this tv is incredible. I looked around a lot before the purchase and was weary at first, but I'm very happy I went with this tv. I went with the 3 year extended warranty to add peace of mind, and still saved money compared to other brands. I'm sold on Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - but BAD plastic smell
Reviews.Author: G. Traveis "Prod Design Engineer"
Reviews.Content: I loved the VIZIO SV421XVT. The picture quality was great.  The sound, using the internal speakers was kind of hit-or-miss depending on how it interpreted the Surround encoding.  I ended up compensating by turning off the advanced Audio features.  I missed a feature that our older Panasonic LCD had - Closed Caption on Mute.  It's a great feature and it comes in handy when a program is on and a call comes in.Once again, I found the picture quality to be great!  But there was one aspect of this TV that forced me to return it - The TV emits a nasty hot plastic odor when running.  We gave it two whole weeks to "air out" but it never got any better.  The plastic stink was the first thing that I would smell when walking into the room.  I finally got sick of it and sent it back.After, I did a sniff check of other >40" LCD TV's.  I found that all of the Vizio's had the plastic stink, as did Toshiba.  Sony, Sharp and Panasonic had no plastic smell at all.Samsung TV's had a mild plastic smell, but the Samsung LED LCD TVs had no plastic smell at all - maybe the ultra-thin chassis doesn't use the same kind of plastic.So, if you are thinking of getting a Vizio, find a new one on display and give the top venting a quick sniff.  Most people don't have problems with the smell, but if you do, you will want to avoid these TVs.UPDATE! As of January 2011 (one year after this review) the latest batch of Vizio flatscreen TV's are being made with a different plastic and are stink-free!

Reviews.Title: "what do I know"
Reviews.Author: ggeneral
Reviews.Content: I must start off by saying that I've never owned a LCD tv or any high def tv of any kind. I say that to say this, my expertise on the matter is nill, so take away from this what you will. I've had this tv for a few months now and so far I haven't experienced any of the problems that I thought I would so far. The set-up was easy, I literally didn't have to do anything except plug it and turn it on. I believe some of that may have to do with the fact that I have directv, so when I hooked it up to my dvr, I didn't have to adjust anything. If the dvr had nothing to do with it, then the set-up was easier than I thought. Delivery was done by fedex and it was on time. I highly recommend this tv especially at this price, it works great with my ps3 and movies and tv look great on it. But like I said, I'm no expertise and if this tv starts to act up in the coming months, you better believe I'll be back on here giving my opinion. As for now, a 42inch at this price is a bargain...

Reviews.Title: First HD TV Purchased
Reviews.Author: New River user
Reviews.Content: As a retired engineer-I research everything before I buy.  Reviewing the various TV manufacturers LG, Samsung and Vizio specs. via Amazon and reading reviews from several other sources, decided to purchase the Vizio because the price with 1080P and 240 Hz was the best buy.Believe I made the best decision and the only problem have had is trying to program the remote so that would not have to use the cable one-have not been successful and with Vizio customer support personnel were not able to help.  However one of their  people told me to send back the set for something that I had done incorrectly in this process.  But I called back and another person walked me through the process to correct my error.

Reviews.Title: IT's a TV
Reviews.Author: W. D. Houser
Reviews.Content: For $499 it was a very good buy! TV works fine and it delivers a great picture. Lets be real...most people will not see any differance between 120 and 240 Hz and if they do, well lets just say BS! This TV works well and delivers on the picture. Only issue so far is the VIZIO name light on the TV base does not go out. It changes from yellow when off to white when on. Very few people receive a 1080p broadcast signal, most are 1080i, Just check your cable box. So the only way to see the true 1080p is with a blueray player and disk. In that, this TV shines.

Reviews.Title: Great deal at this price
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I bought this same TV almost a year ago at a Wal-mart for $900, so this is a very good deal.The picture is crisp, and the thing that impressed me was the speaker quality.  A lot of these big screenTV's have lousy speakers because they figure most people will use their surround sound amplifier and speakers.That is what I used to have to do with my old flat screen until I replaced it with this one...the sound is unbelievable andI hardly ever even turn on my surround sound anymore unless I'm watching a DVD or a concert or music program on the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: I just hooked up this TV and I'm amazed at the picture from the Vizio 240hz. I have been a diehard Samsung owner but I bought this TV because it was the best features for the price. Very impressive, I have DirecTv HD DVR hooked up to this TV in my bedroom, off the chain nice picture. Transformers 2 looks like I'm standing right there! Good job on this 1 Vizio.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40 inch to Vizio
Reviews.Author: Kaison Loggins "queso"
Reviews.Content: Well to start it off i had a 40 inch Samsung, but it was only 60hz... The picture quality was great! but recently i just sold it, so i could upgrade to 240hz... All i can say is it really takes alot of getting used to... It really does give it that soap opera feel to it. Not quite accustomed just yet. Also when it comes down to the Black images they are not as dark as i'd hoped for... My Samsung definitely had sharper colors, because of the 60,000 contrast ratio. This only being 50,000. Don't get me wrong! but the the VIZIO 42 inch shows great! I'm just still getting used to the 240hz from 60 hz... HUGE difference! Also i would recommend getting HD channels, because with the standard it looks pretty fuzzy. Great investment though overall! especially if your looking to not spend over $1000!!!

Reviews.Title: An excellent HDTV in its class
Reviews.Author: A. C. Liu "Christian"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 42" 240hz LCD TV from costco, during a sale event lately for only $699. It is of the same price to the 120hz model, thus I went for this one.The picture quality is superb. I really cannot distinquish it from those of the other high end name brands. The set up is like a breeze. The interface to HDMI is very easy to use. It plays the fast motion scene smoothly.  Watching the HD channels on this TV is a blown away experience. The only complaint is that its manual does not explain the lack of caption through HDMI input at all. It took me some research online to control the caption from the cable box.The sound quality from the speaker is so so. I probably will add a sound bar to enhance it.I have owned it too short to comment on the durability of the product. Only time can tell if its quality control is trustworthy.If it does last, the price is really a bargain, given the quality of the picture.  I rather save the price premium from the name brand TV for buying another newer generation TV later than to get one which lasts forever.

Reviews.Title: My 42" lasted 11 months
Reviews.Author: Doug "D"
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my tv until it wouldn't power on one day.  It is still under warranty and I've been waiting about 3 weeks for it to be repaired. I wish I'd heard of the "Vizio pop of death" before I shelled out over $600 for this POS.

Reviews.Title: Good choice for the price!
Reviews.Author: Ed Mussinan
Reviews.Content: Had it more than a year, and no problems whatsoever.  I am not an audiophile, but the sound is good- better than my old TV. Love the USB port for jump drives

Reviews.Title: Power Supply failed in less than 3 years
Reviews.Author: Euf
Reviews.Content: Very unhappy.  Of course after my 2-year warranty has expired, the power supply on this Vizio tv failed.  Vizio tech support were not much help. I searched the internet and found that other owners experienced the same issue with the power supply.  Vizio prides itself of their tv's designed in USA (but of course they are still manufactured in China).  Bad investment on my part.  I won't buy Vizio again until there are decisive evidences that their products are of the same or better quality than Samsung.

Reviews.Title: awesome picture
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: beautiful picture clearly Vizio is one off the top brands for flat screen tvs! you cant find too many tvs that has 240 Hz.

Reviews.Title: would not buy again
Reviews.Author: Slaten
Reviews.Content: I loved the TV when I got it. The picture was amazing and sound great. 1.5 years in the inferred stopped working and tonight the sound just stopped working. Vizio was no help. you can find a better TV

Reviews.Title: Vizio 42 inch TV
Reviews.Author: larry w riley
Reviews.Content: Absolutely happy with my purchase,  My friends comment on what a great picture I have. Colors are very true. Picture very crisp.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO 42 IN. COLOR TV.
Reviews.Author: John Campbell Jackson
Reviews.Content: I chose this tv for myself as a Christmas gift. Having seen the low price being offered I couldn't pass it up. I have had other tv sets this size an larger but none can compare to this one. Best thing about this set is the great picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Geat tv
Reviews.Author: cementmason
Reviews.Content: I wanted a bigger screen tv for movies when I signed up for netflix. This one was rated high and seemed like a lot of tv for the money. The picture is beautiful and the sound is excellent. I have had it over a year with no issues and have been well pleased with my choice. I would certainly buy again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Keith
Reviews.Content: I've had mine about a year and a half, and the quality of the picture is exceptional. I've had no problems, set up went well, and I am very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: two years later and I still love this TV
Reviews.Author: sigs
Reviews.Content: When I bought this I was picky about the resolution and refresh rate for a tv.  This has been perfect.  I love watching movies, blurays, sports, and just about anything else on this tv.

Reviews.Title: really pleased with this tv
Reviews.Author: LC
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv over two years ago and I am just as happy with it now as I was then. I am not a techno geek, so I can only speak to what I believe to be an incredible picture and very good sound quality. The 240Hz takes some getting used to as it makes some movies and tv shows appear as if they were "taped" rather than "filmed", I wasn't sure if I was going to be able to deal with that look long term, but I hardly notice it now.I have made some adjustments to the video settings, more for my taste rather than out of necessity.The only downside to this tv is it doesn't come with the Qwerty remote or internet apps. However, I bought a blu-ray player with built-in wi-fi so I'm not missing out on anything except maybe the extra $200 it would have cost if the tv had internet apps.

Reviews.Title: USB multimedia
Reviews.Author: atorii
Reviews.Content: This TV performs great, only flaw is when you want to watch AVI format movies from the USB drive.........avi movies do not get recognized at all..... all other format work fine, even when you play music files.........overall i love this TV, and for the price i paid, i consider it a great bargain compared to other TV's with same features.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "lkwells"
Reviews.Content: I ordered through Amazon and it arrived in three days without a scratch. I unpacked it myself ...easy! Because I read the reviews I was forewarned to get  extra HDMI cables, which I did through Amazon as well (for a much cheaper price than Radio Shack or Best Buy). Order two ...the second will come in handy for something else I'm sure.  Since this was my first digital TV I realized I had a learning curve but calling my cable company made it less stressful. They first had me switch out their analogue DVR to a digital DVR(I said I had a learning curve).Unpacking and setting up was a breeze. The HDMI cable it came with made connecting easy and the Wizard walks you through set up. Although figuring out how to set up "Input" took me longer than it should have (more learning curve) but I was soon up and running. Another call to the cable company had them setting me for the digital channels and walked me through getting the control of the TV with the cable channel changer (the cable booklet was out dated for this TV but their TI's had one that worked).I guess I wanted to complicate my life because I also bought a Samsung Blu-ray player as well but hooking it up was also a breeze with the extra HDMI cable I bought (it didn't come with one). I haven't bought the wireless adapter for it so I haven't been able to do any streaming from it yet. I have a wireless set up for my laptop but so far I'm getting enough entertainment through cable channels and Netflix by mail (Bu-ray dvds) and I doubt the streaming is as good as getting the Blu-ray dvds so I'm in no rush.The picture is sharp and fantastic. Movies and my favorite shows are mesmerizing. My husband loves watching his favorite sports shows and the Kentucky Derby felt like we were there. The blacks are black and the color is wonderful, no need to adjust, though you can.The Speakers are great. The sound can be adjusted which I did and got a rich surround sound. They also have plenty of volume. I haven't pushed them too hard as I live in an apartment would hate to blast out my neighbors. I realize having external speakers would make it even better but the speakers sound better than I expected so I will hold out till my son comes to visit ...he is the expert on sound, and let him help me choose and do the wiring for that.I've had it for 4 months now and so far so good. No problems as of yet. I did a lot of research before settling on this one then I ran it by the office TI. He, too, thought it was a good deal for what it offers.  VIZIO SV421XVT 42-Inch XVT-Series 1080p 240 Hz SPS LCD HDTV I love this TV!

Reviews.Title: enjoying my purchase
Reviews.Author: Brattcap
Reviews.Content: At first I wasn't so sure if I was satisfied with my purchase.  It was delivered in a timely manner but the box had a fist sized hole in it.  The delivery guy was very nice and made sure the t.v. was not damaged.  The t.v. was easy to set up except for the volume.  The volume would go up and down from very low to very loud until I messed around and changed some settings.......now it works wonderfully.  The stand was already attached.

Reviews.Title: Vizio TV from Amazon
Reviews.Author: Estelle
Reviews.Content: We are very satisfied with this TV. It was a snap to set up & get running. The price we paid at Amazon was the best that we had found anywhere!!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!!  Superb quality!!
Reviews.Author: Brittany & Chris
Reviews.Content: This is the 1st flat screen tv I've owned and it has exceeded my every expectation!!  With the 240hz refresh and PIP plus 2x15w speakers this TV was the best deal for the money.  Excellent packaging with no damage and comes pre-assembled ready to use right out of the box!

Reviews.Title: Salon Manager
Reviews.Author: Salon LV
Reviews.Content: I wish it still have a special sale $ 549.00 so I can buy 2 more for other Salon. It is a good buy for the good quality of the LCD TV.

Reviews.Title: It's Great
Reviews.Author: ABumblebee
Reviews.Content: This television was a good purchase. We have had it about a month now. For the money it was worth it. If you are looking for a decent size flat screen at a good price this is the one. The only thing was we needed to adjust most of the settings. It was east to navigate through but took a few trys to get the picture we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: Great movies, great TV
Reviews.Author: Drew Armenta
Reviews.Content: Makes movies TVs and stage come together, to make ends meet. Never thought I would be here when it happened! Great movies, great TV!!!

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: N. Brent
Reviews.Content: This is a value display that surpassed my expectations. I wasn't blown away by the black levels or overall contrast ratio, but there are and adequate number of adjustments and settings provided to tweak the picture to your preference and viewing area. I think this is a great display for this price point!Although Vizio is a value brand, there are a few nice touches that may help you forget that fact... such as the volume level that is saved separately for each input, so you aren't blown away by commercials when you switch from your Blu-ray player to the cable input.Speaking of inputs, this one has plenty, and it's one of the reasons I chose this set over a newer LED lit model with less inputs. I only wish the second component input was on the rear rather than the side. Thankfully, it is set back just enough that the cables are not too obvious.Overall I'm very happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Vizio 42" LCD
Reviews.Author: Dan Rubino
Reviews.Content: TV was delivered as ordered and on time w/no problems. The only way they could have made this easier is if they actually came here to mount it!

Reviews.Title: Hubbie's anniversary surprise!!
Reviews.Author: Vicki
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for my husband for our 35th anniversary. We had just moved into a new house and the downstairs den was going to be his "mancave". While I wisked him off to dinner our oldest son installed it and I got to surprise him when we got home. He was completely overwhelmed and LOVES it. Great picture and sound...now I cant get him out of that room :D

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: svmguru
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV to replace my 3-yr old 40" JVC. Got it for an incredibly low $540. The picture quality is great. I had to turn "Smooth Motion" off to remove some jitter I was seeing in some videos. The picture quality was very good for all HD programming. My only complaint is that it did not have a swivel base. Overall a great product albeit older generation (compared to the new line from Vizio that has internet apps and are LED based).

Reviews.Title: Great puchase - couldn't be more satisfied.
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: For the price, this purchase can't be beat. Not only is it a great product, but the shipping was extremely fast and convenient. It seemed a bit risky at first to order a TV that I hadn't seen in person, but I couldn't be happier with my decision.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommend!!!
Reviews.Author: Ashley Bekkerus
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my husband for our family room. We all absolutely love this tv and have made it our new favorite tv to watch. The quality is absolutely great, the sound is clear, and the set-up was fairly simple. I would purchase this same tv if in need of one ever again! I would highly recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: Vizio SV421XVT 42-Inch TV
Reviews.Author: Dino
Reviews.Content: I looked for 6 months before i got this tv. We have had it for 3 weeks and we could not ask for a better set. Easy to setup. Great picture, great sound, great price. Amazon is a GREAT place to shop.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Tiff
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband was looking for a new tv,we did alot of research befor choosing this one.It has a great picture it was worth the price.Me and my husband love playing video games (Xbox 360.It made the games look sooo much better.I would recommend this tv to any one,its great for movies and games.

Reviews.Title: Great TV - Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: This TV works great, especially for the price.  I haven't had any problems with it other than needing to tweak the default settings.  There was a noticeable difference in picture quality between a VGA cable hookup from my computer and the HDMI cable hookup - the HDMI picture was noticeably better.  Also it is a bit bulky compared with the think LED units but they are usually twice the price.Bottom line: great tv, no regrets.

Reviews.Title: VIZIO 42" HDTV
Reviews.Author: J. A. Cabral
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this TV.  Everything has been great.  Picture quality, sound quality and ease of use are top notch.  Had zero issues setting up the TV, hooking up my Blu-Ray player, cable box and Xbox console.  This is my first flat screen HDTV, but easily the best TV I have ever purchased.  I would easily recommend VIZIO TVs.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!! GREAT PRICE!!
Reviews.Author: OCguy
Reviews.Content: This is my first good HDTV and I did a lot of research before buying it(I had a DLP TV before this one....I know, I know, what was I thinking!). Of course the price was a definite factor in my purchasing this TV. You can't beat $550 for what this TV offers. From what I've read in other reviews, there seems to be a "strange plastic smell" that some Vizio TV's give off. Well, first thing I did when I took it out of it's box was take a whiff of the TV, both hoping not to smell anything and expecting some funky smell. Well, I didn't smell anything out of the ordinary. I had a slight "new" smell to it, but that was it. After two weeks of having it, I haven't noticed any smell whatsoever....and yes, I have performed the sniff test more than once to make sure I didn't get a funky smelling TV.There have been complaints about the Vizio logo just below the screen. It may vary from person to person....because it doesn't bother me at all. Even when I pay attention to it....I soon forget about it and watch the amazing picture. It does stay on and is an orangish color when the TV is off and turns white when you turn the TV on. I personally do not find it distracting at all. I have three other family members that I never told about that particular issue that people were having....and they have never even mentioned the light at the bottom. So that particular issue might vary from person to person.Now about the picture....WOW. I hooked up my HD cable box with an HDMI cable and tuned into an HD channel. Wow. The picture is amazing! So crisp and smooth. I know to say you can tell the difference between 120Hz and 240Hz would be a total fib...either way, the picture on this TV is amazing! Definitely better than 60Hz. Like a few others have said, you won't get true 1080p signals from many sources(besides a blu-ray player), my personal cable box gives off a 720p signal. The picture is still amazing. I've hooked up my Xbox 360 to this TV via HDMI cable..and again, wow. Game play is so smooth and crisp. Definite five star picture quality. I can't wait to get a Blu-ray player to really blow my mind!The sound: Through my research of TV's, I've found that LCD TV's are not known for superior sound quality. This particular TV has some good and bad reviews are far as the sound goes. I personally am ok with the sound. I still experience the issue of volume difference when going from program to commercial, though definitely not as bad as my older TV's. It's not surround sound quality, but it's very decent considering the horrible reviews I've read for some TV's.I think the only issue I've had that I would really complain about, is the delivery of the TV. Apparently the delivery company(which is some off brand delivery company) is supposed to call to set up a delivery time. I was counting on this since I knew that there would be a good chance I wouldn't be home around the time it would be ready to be delivered. Well, imagine my surprise when I got home to find my TV sitting in the living room(still in it's box). A family member just so happened to be home when the delivery company showed up un-announced. I was definitely lucky in that regard. So be sure to have someone home when it's supposed to be delivered(according to the tracking number given) because they WILL NOT call you to set up a delivery time.All in all, I am VERY happy with this TV. Great picture, good sound and very good price. I know that are some reviews that say Vizio is a horrible company and product. I suppose like anything it's relative. I haven't seen or heard of a company, product, service ect., that has a 100% approval rating. I personally love their products and will buy from them again.

Reviews.Title: Great television, especially on sale!
Reviews.Author: J. Merritt
Reviews.Content: I got this tv on sale and what a price for a very well sized television. I was a bit worried about the plastic smell mentioned by other reviewers because we don't have a huge family room, but it looks and smells just fine. The picture is super sharp as you would expect and I can't wait to get our first blu ray disc to see just how good it can get. The sound is just fine for me,'though the volume goes up and down very quickly when you hold the button, takes a little getting used to.I turned off the 240hz smooth motion deal pretty much right away. It looked a bit weird somehow, and my wife and I both thought it looked better off. Maybe it would be better for sports, but for most video games and movies it looks overprocessed. It does take a bit of tweaking to find the calibration settings that make everything look good, but the mode button is easily assessable to Riggins through if the colors or brightness is not acceptable on a certain movie or game.The only thing I would change is to add the ability to delete extra inputs from the toggle menu. I end up switching inputs often, and it would be nice to not have to go through the composite and component inputs to get to the HDMI.Yay for big TVs!

Reviews.Title: tv review
Reviews.Author: kmbsjb
Reviews.Content: I found this tv to be very easy to set up right out of the box.  It is not very heavy but the base that comes with it is plenty to keep it steady.  The picture on this tv is so crisp that it is almost surreal.  I wish I would have bought 2 of them.  The only downside to it is the fact that the VIZO logo on the front middle lights up and kind of distracts from the tv.  A little piece of black electrical tape covered it right up and you can't even tell.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: twal2000
Reviews.Content: I love my new vizio 240hz. This is my first hdtv, the colors are clear and vivid and the fast motion is smooth and clear and does not blur. I bought this tv on 01/24/2011. I can't say enough about this tv, except i just love it. I also have my surround sound hooked up which makes it even more better.

Reviews.Title: What a deal!
Reviews.Author: Sandi S. "Sandi S"
Reviews.Content: This set was ordered to replace an older HDTV model that took up a lot of room.  What a picture!  The resolution is fantastice whether I'm watching live TV, a DVD or Blu-Ray disc.  Almost seems 3-D !!  The colors are sharp.The set arrived in 2 days as promised.  Took only minutes to set up & WOW.  Great deal for the $$$.  So what if it's a 2009 model?  It's brand-new and fabulous.

Reviews.Title: 240 HZ ROCKS
Reviews.Author: M. Brandon
Reviews.Content: VIZIO SV421XVT 42-Inch XVT-Series 1080p 240 Hz SPS LCD HDTV  ROCKS. The picture is so much better than the 120 hz. There is NO PLASTIC smell to the tv. It worked the frist time I plugged it in. The picture is flawless. The tv speakers are fine but I also puchased form Amazon a Sony multi channal av receiver. The STR-DH10 wired it up to my Klipsch speakers and my Sony subwoofer. Which sounds excellent. I got the extended 3 year warrenty. I also have an LG Blu-Ray player. Right after I got it all hooked up, and I watched a Blu-Ray movie, Avitar . It was so close too a 3d picture I was amazed. Thinking about buying it again!

Reviews.Title: My first flatscreen
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Beedie
Reviews.Content: When I was doing online research on TV's this model had many good reviews about the picture and sound quality. I always look at the bad reviews (a little moreso than good ones) and several mentioned great tv died in a year. I decided that I would buy the 42" and an extended warranty. Let me tell you, I am so happy with my choice. The size of this TV is huge, the picture is amazing and the sound is incredible. There are many different ports (is that the right word) to hook up a number of devices. There are settings for the picture like, game, movie, etc. It has picture in picture. I think if you are looking for a tv you would not be disappointed but buy an extended warranty just in case.

Reviews.Title: Vizio HD TV is excellent
Reviews.Author: Diane in PA
Reviews.Content: From the minute it showed up at the door we have loved this TV.  It was so easy to install and the picture was so crisp.  Very easy to set up and get the right picture for us.  I would highly recommend this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: LOVE this TV!
Reviews.Author: Stacy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV about a month ago for my bedroom.  I have had absolutely zero problems with it.  In fact, I'm considering putting it in my living room and switching it with my 50 inch TV.  The sound and picture is amazing.  The picture is unlike any other TV that I have seen.  I have not experienced any of the negative feedback others have written about.  I highly, highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: vizio great tv
Reviews.Author: Shane Mcwhorter
Reviews.Content: picture, sound, appearance, a #1---would buy this tv again..  in fact I might buy one for the future.  can't beat the price...amazon was great.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J. Ford
Reviews.Content: Well I upgraded from a 32" AOC Envision LCD to this monster.  This TV is way better than my other TV, which only did 720P.  This TV is nice and the quality is good.  I grabbed this TV because it was on sale here and I don't regret it.  If this TV goes on sale again and someone is looking for a TV grab this one ASAP.

Reviews.Title: good price
Reviews.Author: joe in mb
Reviews.Content: I paid $599.00 for this TV and am happy with it. Some movies have been too dark and you have to change the picture setting. Also thought the remote was broke but changed the batteries and works fine. The remote is really thin and seems fragile. Sound is sometimes too loud on explosions and music and too low on dialogue. That is from tv speakers only. Delivery was free and it was fed ex. I knew the delivery date but they could not give me a time frame at all. That sucked. They ended up leaving it on the side of my house. Best way to track it is by calling them with the tracking #. overall i am happy with TV for the Price i paid.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good
Reviews.Author: Mad About Sports
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from a 36" Sony Wega.  I did a lot of research and basically settled on the fact that I would be buying a Vizio based on the 240 Hz, the pricing and the reviews.  I really wanted to get the sv422xvt because I liked the idea of the internet apps.  I waited for the pricing to come down on it and it never did, so I got the sv421xvt from Dell because I had a gift card.  As it turns out, someone gave me a Tivo which has the internet apps included with it.As far as the sv421 is concerned, the HD channels are incredible.  There was a little bit of distortion for some of the March Madness games we were watching.  We turned the smoothing on high and decreased the sharpness and that helped a little. Still, the image was extremely clear.  The sound is okay.  Nothing great.  I hooked it up to our stereo and it greatly improved the sound.  Unfortunately our cable provider still has a large number of analog channels.  Some of the channels actually look pretty close to HD, but there are several that look pretty grainy.  I think the grainy images are even more apparent because of the difference in the image quality of the HD channels.  For anyone that does not receive any HD or digital channels, these HD LCD's might not be the right TV for you.Delivery went very smoothly.  They did not set the TV up for me, just dropped it off.  Setting up the TV is fairly easy.  Most people should be able to handle it.  The biggest problem was moving out our old TV which weighed 150 lbs.  So far no plastic smell with the new TV.Overall I am very pleased with the purchase and would recommend it.  I am now trying to decide if I should purchase the extended warranty through Vizio.  I also have read good things about the extended warranty that is offered here by Square Trade.  I also would like to buy a Blue Ray player.  Maybe I will go with a Vizio again.

Reviews.Title: Amazing HD picture
Reviews.Author: rie educate
Reviews.Content: I thought long and hard about making this purchase. I even saw the same exact t.v. at Costco for a slightly less price but had to factor in the tax and labor of taking it home. The better deal was with Amazon with free shipping, no tax and having it set up by the delivery guys. It was nice to see the t.v. at Costco and the picture quality. I think the picture quality is even better at home. So for the price that I got  at Amazon and the ease of delivery and set up, I am extremely happy with my purchase. I believe the sound is clear and crisp. It also has the feature where the commercials will come on at a softer level but I don't use it because of my Tivo. My Tivo doesn't make that annoying sound with the fast forward or rewind which is another bonus with this T.V. The H.D. quality is amazing and I had H.D. before on my previous Visio set. It must have to do with the speed I think. All in all, one of my best purchases with Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality and great value
Reviews.Author: Wei Kai Hung
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for the cheap price. The pic quality is better than I expected. It's better and cheaper than Sony and Samsung's 120HZ models.

Reviews.Title: Second time is the charm
Reviews.Author: Anthony G. Sitko
Reviews.Content: We recently received our second TV.  The first one failed out of the box within 10 minutes.  Customer service, while helpful was also tedious.  Why do they insist on reading the script ... geez.  Over an hour on the phone to finally conclude, the TV doesn't work and needs to be replaced.  I was advised after sending proof of purchase they would contact me to arrange the replacement.  That never happened and three days later I had to call.  Another hour on the phone with a automaton reading a script to the same conclusion, TV needs to be replaced.  With replacement authorized it took nearly two weeks for the replacement TV to arrive.  So, TV purchased 12/27  (two weeks to get original delivery and two weeks replacement delivery) is finally set up and working 1/30!  At least it arrived in time for the Super Bowl.  Side note I was always dealing with Vizio customer service.  Perhaps Amazon would have been more helpful and more responsive, but hopefully there will be no need for a next time.Picture quality is great. Set up was easy, although the remote should allow separate control of satellite box and audio volume without having to press the "cable" and the "audio" button in between.  I am using separate audio so no opinion on audio.

Reviews.Title: My VIZIO It's GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Carl H. Werner
Reviews.Content: I looked for months before I finally decided to buy my VIZIO. It so far, wasn't a mistake. The picture quality is great and the sound is, too. Watching HD TV is like almost being there. I would highly recommend this TV to anyone. I think that the 240hz. is the key to it's great picture. I'm surprised that other manufactures haven't started using the same engineering.

Reviews.Title: A Great HDTV at a Great Price.
Reviews.Author: Ed Miller
Reviews.Content: Got this TV for my Son and family for Christmas..he did alot of research on LCD TV's and picture quality.Arrived in a few days..we installed it that night and the picture was breathtaking..In fact, the next TV I get will probably be a VIZIO!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect in every way
Reviews.Author: Bryan "Tech Geek"
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for more.  this tv is pefect.  good sound good color and makes my shows look so so much better then my old viewsonic.

Reviews.Title: Great tv, with 1 problem
Reviews.Author: Daniel Shaver
Reviews.Content: First of all, this tv has a great picture. Which is important for a tv, I'd say. ;)However, if you want to use this for gaming, you may want to look elsewhere. The input lag from the HDMI imputs is roughly 80ms. Might not sound like much, but when you're playing any type of game on your console, it is ALOT. The tv comes with a 'game' mode, but it doesn't seem to help any. I've tried all the various settings to improve the latency, but the only solution I've foud is to use the RGB input instead of HDMI. Which I would be fine with, but there is only 1 RGB input. Meaning that if you hook up your computer and xbox to the tv, you'll have to choose which one you want to have zero latency.For this reason, I'll likely be selling it and buying one with an actual game mode (or else 2 RGB inputs to bypass the image processing)TL;DR: If you plan on using this to watch tv or movies and nothing else, it's great! Great price for a great tv! If you want to use it for gaming, be warned that there is a substantial input lag.

Reviews.Title: Overall a great tv.
Reviews.Author: Mark Hill
Reviews.Content: My only disappointment is that two weeks after I bought it from Amazon Sam's dropped the price on them $150.  This TV has a great picture.  As others have said this tv smelled funny for about the first two weeks.  The only other issue I have had is when I hook a computer up to it sometimes it takes a couple of tries before it recognizes the connection.  It is the best TV on the market for the money.

Reviews.Title: I Have this TV
Reviews.Author: Pherocious "Debra Anne"
Reviews.Content: I have this hdtv. We beat it to death because we are a gaming, surfing, netflixing family. The picture is stunning - there is NO blur with even the most elaborate graphics during fast game play.Very very happy. The aps are no big deal but nice to have = we can slideshow our pics off facebook nicely with no other connections (it's wireless).NO mechanical or performance issues whatsoever and it even sounds good. I gave it four stars because of course it would be better with a home theater system but the built in speakers hold their own.The price is GREAT. I saw it on sale on amazon last year for 759 and missed the sale and then refused to buy it for over 900. I waited and waited and finally went to costco and grabbed it for about 820 total (w/NYC sales tax)Since I picked it up I can't comment on delivery but I would not hesitate to buy this tv at this price!PS Keep in mind this is not a true 240hz. It's basically a super high performing 120. Worth very penny.

Reviews.Title: good deal
Reviews.Author: D. Barries
Reviews.Content: Best price I found on it so far. I compared the picture at the store with others and this had the best.

Reviews.Title: A GOOD DEAL
Reviews.Author: LYNETTE KEEN
Reviews.Content: I DID AS MUCH RESEARCH AS I COULD BEFORE PURCHASING THIS TV.  AMAZON HAD THE BEST PRICE ($848) & I GOT FREE SHIPPING/HANDLING.  I DID NOT TAKE THE EXTENDED WARRANTY BECAUSE MOST OTHER REVIEWERS SAID IT WAS NOT NECESSARY (HOPE THEY WERE RIGHT) & THE COMPANY THAT AMAZON OFFERED TO GET ONE FROM DIDN'T GET GOOD REVIEWS, ITSELF.  MY HUSBAND & I ARE, SOMEWHAT, TECHNICALLY CHALLENGED BUT OUR DAUGHTER IS PRETTY GOOD WITH TECH.  IT ONLY TOOK HER A FEW MINUTES TO SET IT UP & HOOK IN THE CABLE/DVR BOX & OUR DVD/VCR COMBO.  OUR LIVING ROOM IS ABOUT 11 FEET WIDE & THE TV PICTURE IS CLEAR (BUT NOT STUNNING) IF YOU ARE ACROSS THE ROOM (EXCEPT FOR CARTOONS WHICH ARE CLEAR EVEN IF YOU ARE STANDING IN FRONT OF THE SCREEN).  WE DO NOT HAVE THE TV HOOKED UP TO ANY EXTERNAL AUDIO SYSTEM BUT THE QUALITY IS FINE FOR US.  THE ONLY ODD THING THAT HAPPENS IS --- SOMETIMES IF THE TV HAS ONLY BEEN OFF FOR A FEW HOURS, THERE IS A WEIRD BUZZING NOISE THAT HAPPENS AFTER THE TV "RETRIVES THE DATA" & THE PICTURE COMES ON.  THEN THERE IS NO SOUND & YOU HAVE TO CHANGE THE CHANNEL TO GET SOUND. IF THE TV HAS BEEN OFF OVERNIGHT, NO BUZZING BUT YOU STILL HAVE TO CHANGE THE CHANNEL TO GET SOUND. THIS MAY BE OUR CABLE COMPANY'S GLITCH.  WE DON'T KNOW YET. OTHER REVIEWERS HAVE MENTIONED SOUND ISSUES.  BUT, ALL-IN-ALL, FOR THE PRICE, THIS IS A DECENT TV.

Reviews.Title: Inferior HDMI ports
Reviews.Author: J. Dorsey
Reviews.Content: We purchased this TV as a birthday present for my husband whose birthday happened to be on Superbowl Sunday this year. We love the TV. The picture is insanely beautiful. The sound is fine. Our biggest problem! After only two months all of the HDMI ports (used to watch HD satellite TV and our Blu-ray player) just stopped working! All we get is a blue screen. It is going to be at least another week before someone even comes out to try and fix it. We are all really disappointed that this has happened and that Vizio has no explanation as to why our two month old television would stop working. We are able to watch TV through the AV, but we didn't buy the tv for that. Now we are stuck paying for HD satellite service that we can't even view. i have searched online and apparently this is not something that is rare. We bought this TV because of the glowing reviews in Consumer Reports and on other websites. Vizio has some work to do to get my reviews back to glowing.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: C. Rath
Reviews.Content: I purchased my TV the end of November and had the impression I would receive it in about a week, not so... The delivery service was terrible, I had to make the calls trying to track it down and find out, where it was at. after a couple weeks of this I called Amazon to cancel it, they told me I could but I would need to pay for the return shipping fee, NOT.... when I haven't received it yet. after a few calls to Amazon they arranged a different carrier to pick it up and deliver it. The last carrier was great, had the TV the next day. Now it's April, and the bottom line, the TV  is great, however Amazon needs to spend more time looking for dependable carriers.

Reviews.Title: one big plastic smelling crap
Reviews.Author: T. Ball "T.Ball"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the vizio sv421 after hearing all the great reviews and boy was I mislead.I recieved my brand new tv,opened the box and ahhh! that brand new fresh tv smell.I took it to the room of my choice hooked it up plugged it in and turned it on and wallah!! picture looks like crap right out of the box. After making every adjustment known to man, the picture still looked fuzzy and blurry no true image at all.While playing with the picture off and on for hours I started to smell a wierd and strong plastic odor coming from the tv, as stated in previous reviews.I gave it a chance to maybe subside but it didnot so,I decided to box it back up and ship it right back.It sat overnight before shipping it out and I still noticed the plastic smell coming out of the box.I had friends come over to inquire about this great tv and they even said they could smell the plastic stench. I know your not suppose to believe everything you read but, after all the great reviews and ignoring the bad I decided to give this tv a go and Boy was I wrong. For all the positive reviews, these people really need glasses bad and a new nose to boot. I mean, these people actually must work for vizio, trying to market this piece of crap tv.If anyone is reading my review please and I mean please beware of these vizio's

Reviews.Title: Pop of Death after 2 years!
Reviews.Author: J. McGuckin
Reviews.Content: I have had my 42" Vizio 1080p for just over two years.  I LOVED the tv when it worked.  The picture and sound was great.  One morning I woke up and went to turn the tv on when I realized it was dead.  No warning, no nothing.  The tv would turn on and off, but I had no picture and no sound.  After some research I discovered this is a common problem with Vizio.  Do your research before you buy. I will never buy another Vizio bc now I am stuck buying another LCD 2 years later.  What a waste of money.PS-When I called Vizio they were no help.  They knew exactly what our problem was, but because it was over 2 years couldn't help us. They need to fix this problem on this end and not make tvs that die after a few years.

ProductInfo.Features:
50,000:1 Dynamic Contrast Ratio for darker blacks and brighter whites
SRS TruVolume eliminates volume inconsistencies between programming
SRS TruSurround HD delivers immersive virtual high definition surround sound
240Hz displays 240 scenes per second by combining advanced 120Hz technology with scanning backlight
ProductInfo.Name: VIZIO SV421XVT 42-Inch XVT-Series 1080p 240 Hz SPS LCD HDTV
